author: Scott Prather
title: Saints Week 7 Thursday Injury Report
text:
Saints Week 7 Thursday Injury Report By Scott Prather October 22, 2015 4:45 PM Share on Twitter Photo by Sean Gardner/Getty Images 
The New Orleans Saints saw a few key players return to the practice field on Thursday as they continue to battle through injuries. 
Only one Saint did not participate in practice, that being offensive lineman Andrus Peat (MCL) who is not expected to play for several more weeks. 
Eight players practiced on a limited basis, several of which were out yesterday. 
Offensive lineman Terron Armstead (knee), cornerback Keenan Lewis(hip/stomach) and linebacker Dannell Ellerbe (hip) practiced on a limited basis after missing Wednesdayâ€™s practice. 
Punter Thomas Morstead (quad), linebacker Ramon Humber (thigh), defensive back Damian Swann (head), guard Tim Lelito (shoulder), and wide receiver Marques Colston (shoulder) were all limited for the second straight day. 
Safety Jairus Byrd (knee) practice fully. 
The Saints (2-4) travel to Indianapolis this Sunday for a matchup with the Colts (3-3). Kickoff is set for noon.
